page.title: 10PAKEFIELD CARAVAN SITE
page.content: Situated in grid square 53 89, this site is known as Pakefield Caravan Site has been in existence for 20 years. On the site there are 339 {caravans} of which 319 are permanent and 20 are touring vans. At the time of the survey there were approximately 600 people using the site.{Facilities} for the residents consist of a play area, swimming pool, a shop and organised entertainment. There is a doctor, a bank, a public house, a bus service and shops within one mile of the site. The site is situated at the end of Arbour Lane. This is an interesting name for the road. Some people say that it is evidence that, at one time, Pakefield had a harbour. Others suggest that its name should be, not Arbour Lane, but Harvey Lane or Harvest Lane. Arbour Lane now leads only to the edge of the cliff.
